questions.question_text: What steps are required to deploy an application to a Kubernetes cluster using VMware Tanzu Mission Control (TMC) catalog?

discussion.content:
B
 In the left navigation pane of the Tanzu Mission Control console, click Catalog. 2. Click the Available tab and select the cluster in which you want to install a package. After you select the cluster, the packages that are available to install on that cluster appear.
3. Click the package that you want to install.

choices.B: From the TMC Console, in Catalog, from Available Tanzu Packages, specify the target cluster and the package to install
choices.D: Using the TMC CLI, enter the command tmc cluster tanzupackage create
choices.C: Using the Tanzu CLI, enter the command tanzu package install
choices.A: From the TMC Console, in Catalog, select the package to install, select Install Package

questions.question_text: Which Kubernetes object controls what traffic is allowed to and from selected pods and network endpoints?
Which three can be configured in a VM Class in VMware vSphere with Tanzu? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
C. CPU
D. Memory
E. PCI devices

Per the link shown, you can add an optional PCI device not storage.
Answer: CDE

questions.question_text: What is the key benefit of Tanzu Service Mesh Autoscaler feature?

discussion.content:
A.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Tanzu-Service-Mesh/services/service-autoscaling-with-tsm-user-guide.pdf

About Service Autoscaling with Tanzu Service Mesh 1The Service Autoscaling with Tanzu Service Mesh Userâ€™s Guide describes how to use Tanzu Service Mesh Service Autoscaler to configure automatic scaling of microservices.

choices.A: It is a plug-in that only works with vSphere object storage.
choices.C: It is a plug-in that allows providers to expose storage as persistent storage.
choices.D: It is a plug-in that is required for ephemeral storage.
choices.B: It is a plug-in that is only used for clusters which require cloud native storage.
